intro: Siphocampylus pilosus, commonly known as the silky beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and spikes of purple to pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the tribe Plantagineae within the family Plantaginaceae. Siphocampylus pilosus is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
